1553311112.title: Beefy Guys and Doughy Girls

choices: Stay as Hinata and watch her test.
She gets no sympathy from me. Change POV
15533111121.content:
Hinata Hyuga was not a happy camper. Why? Simple, really. She was graduating later today and would need to pass a test to find her partner as new genin. The boys in her class year had been training and practicing for this moment all throughout the last few years. Now even though boys could normally generate chakra of their own it tended to be in such small levels that they could only perform some of the simplest justu. Girls however, were found to be able to generate large amounts of usable chakra and their chakra tended to be even more potent than their male counterparts. You could tell how much chakra a girl generated based on how much fat was on their bodies.

This was in itself Hinata’s problem. No matter how hard she tried she couldn’t gain much weight. Her metabolism work so fast that it was a battle to keep what fat and in turn chakra stores, she had. She was easily the smallest girl in her entire class, having only a small layer of flab over most of her body, and a stomach, which was her largest feature, that just barley peeked out from under her tan jacket. Grabbing a handful of her soft belly she gave a small smile at how it would slightly bounce or jiggle with her movements. She may not seem it but, Hinata was proud of herself for being able to pass the requirements to be Kunoichi despite the difficulties her own body gave her.

Her pride however, quickly deflated as she reminded herself that she was in the grey area, the area between being a ninja or living the life of a civilian and if she failed this test she'd have the life of a civilian to look forward to. To any civilian, whom still retain the old methods of dieting as they didn’t produce much chakra, she was over-weight but, to a ninja she was barley even worth the notice. The closet girl to her size was Ami, who was, to Hinata's shame, twice her size. Poking the lump of fat lying in her lap Hinata gave a depressed sigh. ‘How am I supposed to be of any use to anyone? Yes, my chakra levels are unnaturally large for being so small but, no one would want to be seen in public with someone so small, not when they could have someone like Sakura or Ino.’

It was true. Sakura and Ino, who were currently arguing about who would sync better with Sasuke, were the two largest girls to enter the academy for some years. Both were a head or two taller than the others and were the fattest blobs on legs one might ever see. Hinata just came up to the middle of their chest, if she stood strait as a pole and had more than once been completely engulfed by the flabby forms of the two girls. 'Those were some of the most embarrassing times of my life, right up there with being told I'd make a better teddy bear to some child then a ninja.' She watched the two girls in a depressed fascination, while her hopes and dreams to be paired up with Naruto Uzumaki seemed to, in her mind, be fading into the realm of un-realized dreams.

Naruto Uzumaki was a blond boy that Hinata had fallen for; when she was younger he had tried to scare off a bunch of bullies that were picking on her. Small and as thin as a stick at the time, he had still tried to fight off the group of older bullies; he had sadly ended up being ganged up on and getting beaten for his troubles. Hinata however, had always kept that moment, that brave and selfless act, close to her heart. He hadn’t even known her and had still come to her rescue. Ever since she had watched him as he struggled to achieve his dream and the rest is as they say, is history.

Hinata snapped from her thoughts and memories when the girl assigned to test just before her was called to enter the test room. Shaking the dark thoughts of failure to the back of her mind she called up the memories of her mother and the stories she had once told her. Hinata’s favorite stories were about the ‘Three Sirens’ as they had been dubbed. She had even seen a picture of the three. They were Kunoichi of a dying breed. Each one was able to produce chakra and even use the chakra for themselves, rather than just emit it for their male counterparts to use. This and the fact that they had the slim body-type of Kunoichi in the past on top of their skills in battle had made them legends in their own right.

Where most girls idolized Tsunade, Hinata idolized the red-haired leader of the Sirens’; the only person to come close to matching the famed Forth Hokage on the battlefield during the Third Great Ninja War. Her mother never told her the woman’s last name but, she had learned that she was called Kushina. The picture had shown that she had a slender, but feminine build, fair skin, violet-blue eyes, bright red hair - a trait her mother told her was common amongst the members of Kushina's clan - that reached her ankles, with strands that framed both sides of her face and a yellow clip that parts her hair to the left. Hinata remembered how her mother had once compared her to Kushina when she had been a child. Hinata’s face warmed in glee at knowing the fact that her red-haired Idol had started out allot like her.

She had of course learned the names of the other two ‘Sirens’. The second being a Mikoto Uchiha. The stories about her were far fewer then Kushina’s but, Hinata knew the women was said to be a very gentle and kind woman as well as good friends with Kushina. The picture showed her in casual wear, which next to a battle ready Kushina always managed to get a giggle out of the girl. But, the last of the Sirens had blown Hinata’s mind; for in place of the last Siren stood her own mother, looking as happy as could be, given how exhausted she looked. Her mother had just come back from battle were as Kushina was just being deployed to the frontlines, it was only luck that brought them together at that time, something Hinata was thankful for.

Hinata was broken from her memories of those stories by a sharp nudge in the side. Blinking about owlishly before hearing Iruka-sensei’s slightly amused tone calling for her from the test room entrance. Hinata quickly scurried down to the sliding wooden doors, a small blush being the only show of embarrassment for not responding the first time.
15533111121.title: Through the eyes of a Shy and Chubby girl.

choices: Hinata is called back to meet her partner: Naruto
Hinata is called to meet her partner: someone else
155331111211.content:
Iruka watched as Hinata closed the wooden sliding door behind her at his request before she walked to the center of the small square testing room, shacking the whole way. ‘She’s nervous. Hopefully that won’t affect her chakra dispersion or who will pick up on her chakra signature.’ Coughing to clear his throat he began the standardized method of test giving.
--------------------------------------------
Hinata couldn’t help but, jump slightly at hearing her large muscled teacher cough. She however, shook off the startled look and gave him her undivided attention.

“Hinata, first let me say that I am proud to see you standing here today, ready to find your lifelong partner and begin you career as Kunoichi.” He paused a moment to let the girl take in his small praise, knowing that since her mother’s untimely passing, that she rarely received any. He had to keep the sadness from his face at seeing the girls’ strong reaction to such small praise. “Now I trust that you know what is at stake and what you are supposed to do, but I will repeat it one last to ensure there is no confusion and no excuses.”

"The way of the ninja is composed of two parts, the way of the shinobi and the way of the kunoichi. Kunoichi are the only ones capable of generating large amounts of chakra, but are incapable of wielding more than a tenth of it, which is why you can even use your gentle fist style. Shinobi are the only ones who can wield chakra in vast quantities but, can barely make enough it to perform simple justu, like the Replacement Justu; so the two must always act together. The kunoichi must train to enlarge her reserves and in turn their bodies, in order to hold them, while the shinobi must train his body to make it as strong as possible and learn to wield the chakra their kunoichi lend them. The two must always act together to be strong." Pausing to glance at the girl for a moment, he saw a stronger resolve in her eyes then any of his previous female students. ‘Maybe because, she has something to prove. Not just to us but, to herself. Keep hold of that resolve and you will go far, Hinata.’ Quickly pushing down the smile that tugged at his lips he continued.

“For the first part of your test, we are going to see if any of the shinobi-in-training react to your chakra. If one does than you will join them in completing the second course of the exam, which is given to see if you and your shinobi can work together to complete your objectives. What the second exam is exactly will be explained “IF” your chakra garners a reaction out of any of our shinobi. If not then you will take the solo test to evaluate your skills at a later time. Now I think I’ve stalled you for long enough, so please turn to your right and face the wooden doors opposite from where you entered and release your chakra. If any of them react within five minutes our guest, Anko Mitarashi who was asked to judge our shinobi, will inform us of a reaction. You may begin.”

With a deep breath to help center herself, Hinata made the hand sign for ‘Tiger’ and began to pull her chakra out from within her body and push it towards the door that separated herself from the class of Shinobi and by extension Naruto. She focused herself to the task at hand and kept the images of her beloved blond in mind, spurring her to give it her all. Her concentration broke at hearing the sound of the wooden doors sliding open. A quick glance to the clock over the door showed only three minutes had passed so someone had to have reacted. ‘Please let it be Naruto!’

Sadly all that she heard was a women’s voice saying “We gots a live one here. Boy shot up as if something bit him!” Hinata could practically hear the smile in the older Kunoichi’s voice. And with that she was told to return to her class seat as she would be called back to meet her partner after everyone finished taking the first exam.
155331111211.title: Do opposites attract?

choices: Finding map pieces, claim a mystery item.Beware of chakra eating plants Hinata!
1553311112111.content:
Minutes passed like hours for Hinata and the rest of those who passed. The victorious ladies sat together while the unlucky ones glared in anger and envy. Their eyes focused on Hinata more than the others as the tiny girl was able to find a shinobi while their bodies of far greater mass failed. Hinata felt even more worried as both Sakura and Ino had passed and they were arguing about who was the one who snagged Sasuke. And once again, Hinata was caught between their massive guts hoping she wouldn’t get smothered to near-death like so many other times.

"There is no way Sasuke felt you! Naruto would sooner pick Hinata, then Sasuke would pick you!" Ino yelled at the massive girl. Sakura growled and clenched her fists. "This coming from the girl whose clan has been feeling out either the Nara or Akimichi clans!" Sakura yelled back. Ino, shocked at the statement but, not detruded, pulled her hand back to slap Sakura when a soft cough made them all freeze. Turning Iruka was standing there a small scroll in hand.
"Those who were felt, please come with me. Those who failed please remain. Another chunin will come and speak with you about when your solo tests will be." Iruka said. The girls who passed rose and followed Iruka out in single file. They walked down the hallway and stood before a door.

"In this room, you will meet your partner. You will also face your second test. Thou the methods used to test you may be different for each person, it is all fairly simple. You just need to not die." Iruka said. "What do you mean by that?" Ino yelled. Iruka glared at Ino for her outburst causing the massive girl to shrink back.
"I mean what I said. Your very lives will be at risk and unless you become one you will both die," Iruka said calmly. He paused a moment to let this sink into the girls' minds. “Now know that for some of you the test will seem fairly simple where as others may have a seemingly much harder test. You might be asked to run a length of rough terrain or you may need to recover something form a hazardous forest such as the Forest of Death. Know that each will be chosen at random so even we do not know what you will encounter until you do.” He saw the fear growing in their eyes. 'Good.' "Now when I call your name, you will walk in." He opened the scroll. "Ino Yamanaka" Ino smiled and walked in.

"I know it will be Sasuke," she proclaimed as she entered. Iruka paused for a moment and glanced about. He noticed one or two seemed to pick up on the faint but powerful chakra use behind the door. ‘If they can hone that sense, then all the better.

"Hinata Hyuuga," he called. The small girl walked slowly to the door. Entering she saw blackness. Taking a few unsure steps forward she nearly shrieked when she felt a hand land on her shoulder from behind, but a seal on the floor suddenly glowed bright with power from under them and she saw only white.
------------------------------
Shocked and slightly dizzy from the transport seal, Hinata tried to rein in her wobbling body, to no avail. Feeling herself fall backwards she shut her eyes in preparation for the pain to come only to feel a set of strong arms catch her. “Easy now, your still off balance from the sudden shift.” Hinata’s eyes snapped open. She knew that voice it was… “N-n-naru-uto?!?” she squeaked out, looking into the bright blues of the boy she had hoped for.

She saw the smile spread across his face and felt her cheeks grow warmer. “That’s me. Naruto Uzumaki, future Hokage and soon to be full-fledge shinobi… with your help… of course.” He gave her a quick once over, passing the increased redness of her face off as something else, and took in her feature. Now the boys’ class had spent time with the girls on more than one occasion, the purpose being that they were to learn at least one thing about each possible partner as well as their name. “Your… Hinata, right? Hinata Hyuuga?” She could only nod as she didn’t trust her voice. She felt him help her stand strait before he moved back a step. Looking her secret crush and new partner over she noticed a change since she had last seen him, all of two nights ago.

His Orange windbreaker jumpsuit was no longer present instead he wore a black long-sleeve shirt with a black vest jacket, the former clinging to his muscled body. Both having dark-burnt orange strips moving horizontally across. His pants were loose cargos with many extra pockets and a set of loops to place scrolls on the outer-side of his left leg. The pants kept with his earlier pattern of burnt orange strips though the lining and edges were also orange. His kunai holster and sandals were a dark blue, almost black; she could only assume that his shuriken pouch was the same. It seemed he had also forgone the goggles he use to wear and now let his hair fall free, causing his blond bangs to cast his eyes in a light shadow. Hinata only thought that it brought the blue in his eyes out even more. He was of course taller than her being about the same height a Sakura and Ino had been. The confident air and feeling of power rippling beneath the surface only served to make her feel even smaller than she all ready was, but, his friendly smile, enhanced by his whiskers, and playful twinkle in his eyes only made her want to smile and embrace him like she was meeting an old friend. Instead she just blushed and gave a shy smile while tugging on the hem of her jacket and shuffling her feet.

“So, Hinata. Iruka-sensei didn’t happen to tell you anything about our second test did he?” Naruto asked. She simply gave a small shake of her head before noticing where they were. It was a forest of some sort. The trees were larger than any she’d ever seen. She also noted that it seemed rather dark do to the tree covering. “Hey, Hinata!” Giving a small ‘epp’ in shock she turned to Naruto who seemed to be pointing at a note pinned to a tree by a kunai. Rushing over to see they both read it over to find it was info on their test.
1553311112111.title: Naruto: Konoha's Tiger

choices: 4 hours later, three clues and Hinata eaten 5 times. They are tired and hungry.
4hours, three clues and no trouble found yet.
15533111121111.content:
To the Shinobi and Kunoichi reading this note. Your test involves the following…

         -Six map fragments of the area (one you now have, please see bottom)
         -One set of instructions and vague clues to find your other map fragments (Please see bottom)
         -One mystery item that you need to claim to end this test (Note: the clues might help you with this... or not)

Your test is as follows.

You must retrieve the six fragments of the map to find the hidden location of your mystery item. Use the clues to find them. Kunoichi rely on the skills of your Shinobi but, don’t forget your own skills to defend yourself and your Shinobi. Shinobi, defend your Kunoichi at all cost. If your Kunoichi dies you 'will' fail your test and be stripped of your Shinobi privileges. Please note that this test will not end until your deaths or your success.

WARNING: This forest is known for its Chakra eating Flora (plant life). All Kunoichi who do not wish to end up digested alive for your chakra by some plant, please exercise EXTREME CAUTION!!!

Shinobi remember that your Kunoichi is not some tool or battery for you to simple use. They are your partners for the rest of your ninja careers. Kunoichi, please remember that your Shinobi is not some knight in shining armor here to sweep you off your feet. They are your protectors and guards against those that will try to harm you however, do not think they will always come to your side when you are in trouble. You were taught skills to survive in cause you Shinobi was ever killed or unable to defend you, BE SURE TO USE THEM!!!

To all that take this test Good luck, you will need it.
----------------------------
Naruto and Hinata gave each other a worried glance before turning back to take their first set of clues and map fragments.

“Well, Hinata. Lets’ get started.” Naruto said as he grabbed hold of the girl shocking her as he picked her up bridle-style and leapt off towards what they hope would led to the next clue.
15533111121111.title: The Note...

choices: Return to Naruto and Hinata as they fight to finish the test.
155331111211111.content:
She was happy. There was just no other way to put it. Hinata Hyuuga was happy with her life. She had grown into quite the capable Kunoichi in the last few years. She stood about 51/2 feet tall with long night colored hair falling down her back to just over her rear. Her body had grown slender with curves in just the right places. Her round perky breast had grown even larger with the knowledge of her soon-to-be second child. She had of course fought her body every step of the way to the current point in time in order to retain her thin layer of fat and pudgy belly. She didn’t know why but, any questions that plagued her mind were silenced at the fact that her husband, the 5th Hokage Naruto Uzumaki just seemed to love fondling it during their private times together.

Dressed in a casual light purple kimono befitting the wife of a Kage, she was currently walking into a meadow to join her Husband and their first born child in a picnic. They just loved their little girl. Five years old with light blond hair and cream colored skin, little Shion Uzumaki was loving bundle of energy. Her lavender eyes that held just a hint of blue to them always seemed to sparkle in joy when with her parents were there. Hinata was grateful that she had been Naruto’s chosen partner all those years ago. The adventures they shared, the love that grew between them… She snapped out of her musings when her little girl latched on to her leg and giggled at her.

The picnic went by in a blur, laughing and smiles as they watch Shion chase the butterflies and she traded fond memories with her beloved. However, it all changed from wonderful dream to horrible nightmare when she heard him say those hurtful words. The words he spoke held such cold resentment that she felt like she had been dipped in ice. “Why would I want someone like you as my Kunoichi? We nearly failed the second exam because of you being so weak!”

She looked at him with shock and hurt clearly on her face. “He’s right.” Turning she saw her father looking at her with cold hate. “You worthless daughter of mine. You shame the clan and your parents with your weakness!” Each word felt like an ice-cold knives being driven into her heart but, it was his next words that filled her with dread. “For your shameful weakness I hereby brand you with the Caged-bird seal.” A pain on her forehead made itself known causing her to cry in pain and agony at the branding. Whimpering pitifully she looked to her husband for help but found only the cold stare of her father in his place. “I saved you… over and over again I saved you…Do you know why?... Because, if I didn’t then the village would strip me of all shinobi related rights. In the end you were only a burden.”

Tears of pain and disbelief ran down her face now and only turned her gaze at the sound of small footsteps. ‘Shion… surly my own daughter wouldn’t hate me so… would she?’ Hinata had her answer as she looked into the cold hateful eyes of her dear daughter, the Caged-bird seal on her forehead standing out against her pale skin. “I hate you Mother. I wish father never saved you from those plants in your exams!” her little girl sneered and spat out ‘Mother’ like it was something vile.

‘No… No… this … this isn’t right. I… I haven’t…’ Hinata was never given the chance to finish her thoughts as a sound that she thought she would never hear again made its way to her ears. Turning she could only raise her arms in a feeble attempt to ward of the thing she found looming over her. She screamed in horror and despair as it lunged, enveloping her in one bite.
-------------------------
Hinata snapped awake and nearly shirked in terror, instead she chose to gage on the scream that wished to be let loose and simply started to quietly sob to herself. Shaking at what she had seen in her nightmare and hugging herself for comfort she simply cried into her black and orange striped pillow.
--------------------------
Naruto was tired. Even he could get worn down with all that had been happening. So they had decided to sit and rest in a tree branch. Naruto sat, his mind quite, senses sharp for anything that might be a threat. He had learned to be a light sleeper if he was guarding something. Something he had learned to do thanks to Iruka-sensei and Anko’s aid. He sat with his back to the tree, Hinata safely in his lap and held close. His short nap was interrupted when he felt Hinata suddenly stiffen. His shirt grew wet, having given his vest to Hinata as a makeshift blanket. He could feel her quite sobs as she curled into herself. ‘Nightmare most likely. Then again, I’d like to see someone be eaten five times by plants in four hours and still be able to get a good-night’s sleep.’ He thought.

Frowning at his uncertainty of what to do he decided to simply give to her what he had always wanted when woken by a bad dream. Wrapping his arms around her in comforting manner, or what he hoped it was, he started to rub her back and rock slightly here to there and whisper that everything was alright, that she was safe. He lost track of how long it took for her sobs to subside but, was happy to see that she had fallen back asleep while clutching him tightly to herself.

Seeing a small smile grace her face as she soon started to nuzzle his chest, he sat back and wondered ‘why?… why do I feel such a need to comfort her? Why does seeing her in any kind of pain make my heart hurt, or make me wish to beat whatever or whoever hurt her into paste? I know this isn’t just about her being ‘my’ Kunoichi…’ Glancing at the cute chubby face of the girl in his arms he brushed a loose bit of hair from her face and wondered, ‘Just what sort of hold do you have over my heart Hinata Hyuuga? Why do I feel that you could either keep my heart safely tucked away or just as easily crush it to dust in your hands? Guess I’ll just have to find out for myself, huh?’

And with that he leaned back against the tree and slept, his dreams filled with images of the girl in his lap and her scent of lavender with a hint of sandal-wood.
-----------------------
*In the office of the Hokage*

An old balding man sat in his chair, biting on the end of his pipe as he watched the video of near mishaps of his favorite blond-haired prankster. ‘I glad we placed those special seals on to the back of those map pieces. Had we not then I’d be even more worried than I am now, about those two… hmm… maybe sending them to a chakra eating forest wasn’t such a bright idea after all.’ He mused.

“With how dense the girls’ chakra is on top of her unnaturally large reserves, coupled with her small size, I can see why they are being tracked by the more aggressive Flora.” He muttered as he watch the poor Hyuuga be eaten for a fifth time, this time by a pod like plant that had waited till Naruto was too far to hear her be caught as it sprung down right on top of the girl only to shoot back up to its resting place, the girl trapped inside with the acids soon to come. He watched with baited breath as Naruto search everyone of the venues flytrap like plants for his chunky kunoichi. ‘The only reason she survived that encounter was due to a drop of acid-slime landing on his vest. Had that not happened… Uhg… I don’t even want to think about how I’d break it to her father. For all the shit he’s forced to put her thru he does care deeply for his little girl.’

Hiruzen Sarutobi, the Sandaime(third) Hokage, could only hope that the man would be prepared to do what was needed to keep his first-born daughter safe. If worse came to worse, Hiruzen had the betrothal papers for Hinata and Kushina’s son, Naruto ready. That would force the Hyuuga clan elders to back off or risk a clan war, in which he would give Naruto his full support.
155331111211111.title: Nightmares and hope for the Future.

choices: Try using stealth to get around and into the cave.
1553311112111112.content:
They awoke hours later with Hinata blushing a bright red at having spent the night in her ‘secret’ crushes arms. Naruto had soon surprised her by performing an advance clone justu known as ‘Shadow Clone’. It surprised her because such a justu would require large amounts of chakra, chakra that she had not supplied him with. Naruto had quickly explained how he seemed to have larger amounts of chakra then most males in his body and that allowed him some major advantages in justu and chakra use. Though, Hinata did find out that he couldn’t make more than three at a time before collapsing from chakra exhaustion.

Watching him send out his clones to secure some food, they silently gathered some firewood. It turns out that they didn’t even need to send the clones out as they were attacked by a group of large brown chakra bears. These bears were a lot like vampires, only for chakra. They would drain a target of their chakra by merely being near it then when its prey was too weak to fight back it would tear into its flesh. The smallest of the three was sadly a full foot taller than Naruto, when on its hind legs, were as the largest towered over poor Hinata, making her feel like a flea fighting a giant. Naruto had dispelled his clones and re-summoned them to fight this new threat; thankfully it didn’t take too long for Naruto, with some aid from Hinata, to take down the three would-be predators. This led to them quickly setting up a fire and Naruto clones skinning and gutting the smallest bear for food, the other two already sealed away for later.

By the time Naruto and Hinata had had their fill three-fourths of the bear was gone. Naruto had had a good portion of its meat but, Hinata had eaten so much that her stomach was three times the size it had been before eating; unknown to Naruto this was due to a special justu for Kunoichi to help put on more fat and increase their chakra reserves. For the next hour they just sat there as Hinata laid back groaning, as she had never eaten so much at once, while her stomach tried to break down its large meal. Naruto sat with her, and at her request was rubbing her overstuffed tummy to try and help it along.

Time skip: hour and a half later
Hinata was feeling better now that she wasn’t overly stuffed, her stomach having shrunk down by a quarter of its size and was still working on its’ meal. After Naruto sealed the rest of the bear meat away they had began looking for the rest of the map fragments and had found them, rather quickly to their surprise. They then started trying to put the map pieces back together and found that when the proper sides connected they would latch together and meld into one piece. After they completed to map it showed where they were in correspondence to where they needed to be, so they set off to the very center of the forest.

Time skip: Hours later
It took most of the day to get around the plants and animals before making it towards the center of the forest. Hinata had grabbed a quick snack behind Naruto’s back in the form of a small rabbit; she had used the justu for kunoichi and swallowed the poor thing down without killing it first. She was just glad Naruto didn’t notice the odd movements of her stomach or passed it off as her stomach simply finishing off the last of the cooked bears meat from earlier. She swore to herself to never tell any of the other kunoichi about swallowing a rabbit whole, the last thing she wanted was for the others to get ideas on how else to use it.

Feeling Naruto stop moving, as he was still carrying her, she notice that they had stopped on the edge of a clearing, one filled with a very rare sight. A cave stood on the other side of the clearing but, between them were a pack of beautiful white-tigers who were lounging in the clearing. Hinata counted 7 tigers total. Two cubs playing off to the side, judging from the small size and speed built structures of their bodies two of the adults were male and the other three large and powerful looking ones were the females. White-tigers were very rare, so much so that to kill one warranted a punishment near equal to that of treason, and not just in Fire country but, all of the nations with Hidden villages held the same ruling. There were, of course, exceptions to this rule, like if you are being attacked by them and cannot get away without it, then you are still punished thou not as severely. That however was not the thoughts on Hinata’s mind, no, the only thing on her mind was that these seven tigers could be the last of their kind in the five great nations.

They sat there for a few minutes, just watching the rare sight before them. Hinata had once seen a white tiger cub up close when she was a little girl. It had somehow gotten in to the village without being noticed but, instead of being scared of it, Hinata had at the time, tried to pet the ‘pretty kitty’ as she had called it. If someone was to ask if see was scared of tigers from that encounter she would say no, and that now her two favorite animals were foxes and white tigers.

“Hey, Hinata.” Turning her head to look at Naruto she saw he had their map out and he was pointing towards the cave. ‘That can’t be good.’ “We need to get inside that cave, any ideas?” She bit her lip in thought and took a look around. “W-we could try to s-sneak arou-und.” Looking towards the sky she saw that night would soon be falling that would be the best time normally for stealth, but this was against tigers. Stealth may just not be possible here. “Well, I do have a second idea if you want to try it.” He said while pulling out five sticky notes with seal designs on them. Perplex she asked, “Wh-what do those do, N-naruto?” “These are paralysis and restraint seals though I only have enough for the adults. It won’t hurt them but it needs to be stuck to their heads to work.” He explained.

After a moment to weigh the pros and cons of both they choose to…
1553311112111112.title: Test and Tigers

choices: An hour later: Inside the cave
Something else (just to open more possibilities for the story)
15533111121111121.content:
Deciding that a surprise attack would likely work better than trying to sneak around a group of natural predators they went about making a plan. Hinata would deal with the two cubs as she could do so without killing them, were as Naruto would slap the seal tags on as many of the adults as possible with the use of Shadow clones. These clones would be powered by Hinata’s chakra as Naruto didn’t have enough to make them and fight off the tigers at the same time.

Placing her hands on his stomach, to give the most stable connection, Hinata poured her chakra into Naruto while trying to stop herself from indulging and rubbing his abs. Naruto with his eyes closed focused on her chakra, and molding it into the proper shape for his clones. He let it gather within him before performing the hand seal for his justu, and with a thought of 'Shadow clone justu’ Hinata found herself nearly surrounded by the five Narutos’. ‘So many Narutos…’Feeling faint she pushed it away with a surprising amount of determination and forced her blush down as best as she could.

The real Naruto quickly passed one seal-tag to each clone and with a quick nod to each he and his clones seemingly vanished. Confused at his sudden disappearance as well as slightly disappointed at no longer being surrounded by her blond crush, Hinata looked to the clearing just in time to see the five Naruto’s land right in the center of the five adult tigers. She leaped down to the edge of the clearing, drawing the attention of every tiger strait to her. She froze for a moment in fear only to see Naruto spring into action. Before the tigers could even figure out what had happened Naruto clones had already slapped three tags onto their targets before dispelling themselves.

Hinata watched as the last two, a male and the alpha-female from the looks of it, managed to scramble away from Naruto just before the tags could be placed on them. She saw the male jump at one just for the blond to duck; this however meant that the tiger would land upon the Naruto whose back was facing it. Moving to run and warn him about the tiger she realizes only after that she had forgotten something important. Two something’s, both of which slammed into her from the side and behind.
--------
Naruto had just dodged the tiger only to feel the memories of his last clone hit him a few moments later. The clone had managed to turn around and slap the tag onto the pouncing tigers’ nose just before the tiger slammed into it, causing it to dispel. Turning, he faced the last of his feline foes.
--------
The white tiger did not understand this human. It wore the colors of its cousin kin yet, didn’t hold the scent of their blood on him, nor did it kill her pack as she could see that they still breathed. ‘What could this human want? Is he after the summoning contract for Byakko and his kin?’ this thought worried the tiger as well as angered it. ‘If these humans think they can take our contract by force then they are mistaken, and when they fail they will know that I, Tengantsuu (clairvoyance), Last of Byakko’s earth realm kin was the one to stop them.’ The tiger now known as Tengantsuu, gave the equivalent to a smirk at the end of her thoughts.

For the next few minutes she pounced and clawed at the human in her cousin kin’s colors, only to never land a blow. She had seen the odd papers on her pack mates faces and knew that if this human did the same to her, then they would be at its mercy. Readying herself for another try at the human she paused at seeing movement from the corner of her eye. Chancing a glance her heart nearly stopped… ‘Human…female…the cubs!’ and with that she turned to deal with the human that would dare endanger the cubs of her pack.
----------
When the weight of two tiger cubs slammed into her she had at first been terrified. That feeling had passed however, as they started licking her face and nuzzling against her. Next thing she knew she was wrestling with the two cubs and mimicking their growls. She now found herself lying on top of the male cubs back keeping it from getting up while the female cub was stretched out with its stomach on her back keeping her down. Looking at the face of the girl cub, Hinata would almost think that it was giving her a smug smirk. Hinata giggled, she was having more fun with these cubs then she could remember having in a long time. This changed when she saw the alpha-female charging at them with her fangs bared. Luckily Naruto appeared in front of the tiger and managed to slip the tag on its face, right on the forehead.

Time skip: 15 minutes later
Hinata had continued to play with the cubs but, she was still worried. After catching the alpha, Naruto had simple sat down on a small rock making him eye level with the tiger and proceeded to do nothing but, sit and stare in the eyes. She paused in her wrestling with the cubs when she saw him pull out a scroll and open it. A poof and the leftover meat from one of the chakra bears was now sitting before the alpha. At the appearance of food the cubs had quickly hurried over to the pile of fresh meat and began to dig in. Hinata watched in fascination as Naruto looked the tiger in the eye once more before suddenly ripping the seal off of its forehead. Stiffening a gasp, Hinata ran over as fast as she could to stop the tiger from attacking her Naruto, only to stop when he turned to her and gave a small shake of the head.
------------
Tengantsuu watched the human curiously, as he ripped the tag from her head. As she saw him turn to look at the female, ‘His mate maybe?’, she knew that right then would be the best time to strike but, something held her back. After staring defiantly into this humans eyes for so long she felt a… connection to him. As if they had simple been two animals who meet each other and had a friendly, if slightly tense, conversation.

Looking to the cubs, she saw not a scratch on them and that they seemed happy with the playing they had just done. Turning to move towards the others of her pack she walked slowly, glancing over her shoulder every so often to ensure that the cubs were safe. Hearing the sound of movement she turned her head the other way to see the male human moving towards her frozen pack only to stop and turn to face her as if waiting for her. After a few minutes of speaking to her pack with the human far enough behind her that she felt comfortable, she turned to him with an excepting gaze.

The human happily took this as his queue and started to remove the tags from her pack mates. They took the next few minute to simple sit or stand in most case, near each other while watching how the cubs tried to pull the human girl into another game of chase and pounce. During this time Tengantsuu started to think that maybe these humans were more trust worthy then she first thought.


(Basic idea of how Hinata looks after eating http://browse.deviantart.com/?qh=§ion=&global=1&q=chubby+hinata#/d4p6iq1 )
15533111121111121.title: Go with Naruto’s plan.

155331111211111211.content:
http://quack14.deviantart.com/#/d4p6iq1 look under Chubby Hinata for same pic as last chapter.

Hinata was happy that they stayed with the tigers for a time. After the cubs had thoroughly tired themselves and her out she had stayed with them, petting their warm fur as they purred as best a tiger could to the gentle strokes of her hand. But now she and Naruto were making their way through the cave, looking for whatever they needed so they could leave the forest and pass their genin test and earn their headbands.

Reaching the back end of the cave they saw a wooden door. Opening it they saw a small closet, it was tall enough for Naruto, if he didn’t mind his head touching the ceiling, and was wide enough for Hinata to squeeze into if she tried. Half of the closest was occupied by the white marble block, making it stand out in the darkness of the cave. Upon the block was a scroll and a book. The scroll looked as ordinary as could be. Tan scroll with black edge-borders, but, written in the center was what made the scroll so special.

“A Shinobi guide to battle” written by Minato Namikaze.

It was a scroll written by the Forth Hokage himself. This of course caught Naruto’s attention right away as he nearly made a grab for the scroll. Hinata however, smiled at her crushes wish to learn more about his hero, she only wished she could do the same. Looking at the book she saw it was a dark-red, nearly brown in color, hardcover book with a latch on the side using what looked like a seal for a lock. It was however the title and name of the author that got her attention.

“Song of Sirens: A Kunoichi Guide to better themselves” Written by: The Scarlet Siren, Kushina Uzumaki

This made Hinata gasp as the revelation that her hero Kushina, if it was the same one, was in fact a relative to the very boy she was partnered to. ‘Relatives of two sirens as a ninja pair. But what is Naruto's connection to Kushina? I know that she died fighting the Kyuubi and even pieced together how she was killed. Mother confirmed it and even told me how her body was found in the Fourth Hokages' arms, suggesting a possible relationship outside of being a pair... Naruto... Naruto couldn't be their... child?!?... Could he?’ she wondered, as her hands trembled, wishing to take hold of this piece of history and learn from it. The fact that it came from Kushina herself would give her more insight to the woman' life then any text book or ninja record.

Sadly, she took notice of the wooden plank set on the wall between the scroll and book. On it was a message.

Kunoichi and Shinobi,
You’re not dead!?! Well, a congrats are an order for making it here. But, before you even think that you are done you have one last test. Lying before you are a number of items chosen by the Hokage themselves. Your job is to choose only one. The item you chose will from that point on belong to the two of you. Think of it as a reward for not dying. What you do with your chosen reward is up to you but, the moment you grab hold of one you will both be sent back to the Kage tower where you will receive instructions on where to gain you new headbands and start you careers together. So congrats genin and just remember this piece of wisdom on you first mission. "Just don't die!"
----------

Office of the Hokage
Hiruzen Sarutobi was watching with baited breath. They needed an item to show that they had passed their exam and either the scroll or the book would work. ‘Their choice here will have a major impact on their future. Minato’s scroll will aid Naruto greatly and if he can crack the code maybe even learn his fathers’ prized justu. Sadly, the same can't be said for Hinata. The book however, is a different matter.’ Sarutobi sat back in his chair taking a puff of his pipe; his eyes never left the viewing globe. ‘Kushina’s book can only be opened by an Uzumaki, or someone tuned to one, like Hinata. The book should contain training methods for kunoichi as well as sealing methods for an Uzumaki to learn. Her ken(sword) justu style might even be in those pages and since the other two Sirens helped to make the book into a trilogy, who knows what else they might find.’

He smiled at seeing how the two were talking, trying to figure out which one to take. ‘No matter which one they take someone will become a legend, but the question is will only one of them benefit or will they both?’
155331111211111211.title: An hour later: Inside the cave

choices: The next day, the Hyuga elders begin to cause problems for Hinata.
1553311112111112111.content:
Hinata Hyuga was currently on her way home. She and her partner Naruto had just been granted their headbands by the Hokage himself. But more than that had happened in the short time between their return and now. Clutching a small dark-red hardcover book to her chest Hinata pondered on the things the Hokage had told them and the things he had simply hinted at, but most of all she wondered what it was the Sandaime Hokage had wanted to tell Naruto without her there. The thought both depressed her a bit and intrigued her. ‘He already told us about Kushina and how she was in fact Naruto’s mother as well as the connection to the land of Whirlpool. *sigh* I still can’t believe that I was right. That Naruto’s mother was Kushina, the Scarlet Siren, The Queen of Storms and The Bloody Whirlpool. On top of that Naruto is so kind and gentle, not to mention so warm.’ Her face flushed a bright red at that thought as it brought up how she had spent her time asleep wrapped in his arms. Smiling at the memory she silently hoped he wouldn’t mind if she slept in his arms every night they were together. Blushing brighter she speed up so to get home quicker, it wouldn’t do to faint in the middle of the street.

Hokage’s Office

Naruto had been annoyed at how the Old man had simply sent Hinata home on her own so suddenly but, now after hearing what he had to say, Naruto felt he understood why. His face was hidden in his hands and his body slumped forward with his elbows resting on his legs. Here sitting before the Hokage Naruto felt so lost. “I’m sorry Naruto but, I felt that you needed to know this now rather then find out on your own or from someone else later.” The words came from the old man sitting behind his desk, hoping to give the young boy before him some comfort no matter how small it may be. The blond spoke up, choking on the first few words as he tried to come to terms with what he had learned. “I-it’s all right Old Man. I, it’s just some much to take in. My mother was Kushina Uzumaki, the last known member of the Uzumaki clan from the village of the Swirling Tides. And if not for her, the Forth would never have been able to stop the Kyūbi, the very creature sealed into my body. Then there is the whole honoring my family thing with the symbol of the Swirling Tides village on the back of every chunin and Jounin vest, yet this village treats me so poorly because of the same burden my mother carried. My emotions are all over the place. I’m happy that I finally have some knowledge of my parents even if it’s only about my mom, but I’m angry at this village. My mother died to save it and to save me, her crest is on the vest of most of the ninja forces of our village yet, I’m treated like shit. Yet, I still love this village if for nothing else then the fact that my parents loved this place so much and because like mom I’ve found my partner. I-I need some time to think Old Man.”

Sarutobi looked at the young boy before him and couldn’t help but, feel guilty about putting so many burdens on to this one person. He knew that there were even worse burdens that would in time come to bear down on the boy but, he would give the boy as much time as he could before Naruto had to face them. Sadly one such burden was rearing its ugly head sooner then he would like, but maybe some good news first. “Very well Naruto. Take some time to relax and sort it all out before you meet your assigned sensei.” Reaching into a draw he pulled out a shiny new key as well as a copy with a note attached. “Here you go my boy. Do enjoy your new home.” And with that he tossed the items toward the blond who caught them with a confused and bewildered look. The old leader merely chuckled before answering his unspoken question. “Consider it a graduation gift from an old man, besides most partners tend to live together. You couldn’t do that with your old apartment and yes ‘all’ of you things have been moved there already.” The blond sputtered and blushed as he realized his secret storage area under his floorboards weren’t so secret after all. A thought occurred to him that made him blush even more. “Wait, Old Man. Live together as, as in…” The old man in question merely gave an innocent look as he spoke. “Why yes Naruto. Together. As in you and your female partner living under the same roof, sharing the same space and maybe even the same bedding if you follow the footsteps of most partners.” He took a moment to watch Naruto’s face turn so red he could swear the whole village might see boys blush. ‘Now for the clincher.’ “Besides Naruto, how do you think your mother and father had you? They were partners and were quite happy to be able to spend time together… alone… where no one could see what they were doing.” Seeing the poor boy rush out of his office faster than you could say “Free Raman” sent the old man into a fit of laughter as he hadn’t been lying at all.

Hyuuga Compound

Hinata was cursing herself for not paying attention when she entered her home. As soon as she had removed her sandals and started walking towards her room she was attacked. She had only the sound of small feet thundering down the hall strait at her to act as a warning, and only a few seconds worth at that. Shifting her stance as to try and brace herself was futile as a small blur slammed into her, knocking her to the ground with a loud “oof” as the air was knocked from her lungs. Lying on her back and staring at the ceiling for a moment Hinata looked down towards the little firecracker that had just bulldozed her. She saw a little seven year old girl, with long dark brown hair and large, white eyes with a hint of lilac in them. The little girl who was burying her face in Hinata’s bosom, was Hanabi Hyuga, Hinata’s little sister.

Hinata felt Hanabi mutter something into her bosom. Sighing with a smile on her face Hinata forced herself to sit up before scooping the little girl into her arms as best she could. Hanabi immediately latched herself around Hinata’s neck and hugged her. Hinata knew it was from Hanabi missing her and Hinata really didn’t know how long she had been gone, the Sandaime had told her that time seemed to move differently in the forest they went to. For all Hinata knew, she could have left Hanabi alone for only a few hours to maybe a few weeks. She simply sat there for a few minutes, holding Hanabi close before picking up the book Naruto had asked her to hold on to. Securing Hanabi in her arms, Hinata stood as started to once more walk to her room; she was however stopped once more but, this time by her father. “Hinata.” Stopping, Hinata greeted her father as best she could seeing how she couldn’t bow in respect with Hanabi in her arms. “F-father. Hello.” Standing before her at 5feet and 9inches of lean muscle was Hiashi Hyuga. He was wearing his traditional, loose fitting robes with a long-sleeved, brown haori, his long dark brown hair hanging freely behind him as he looked over his chunky first born daughter. “I trust your partner was able to keep you safe during you exams?” “Y-yes, father.” “Good. At least you have a capable partner, try not to cause him too much trouble.” He ignored the downtrodden look of his eldest and focused on his youngest daughter. “Hanabi, you know you have shown a great deal of disrespect to Ko by running out of your training session without approval. You will be punished later thou, for now go and get washed up before coming to dinner.” And with that Hiashi left.

Looking to Hanabi, Hinata now noticed that she was still in her training clothes consisting of a sleeveless, blue v-neck shirt, with mesh armor underneath and blue shorts and sandals. Giving the curious looking seven year old a kiss on the forehead to show nothing was wrong, Hinata suggested they take a bath together. This of course got an instant approval from the girl who squirmed out of Hinata’s grip to gather her bathing supplies. Hanabi was happy to have her big sister and mother figure back home.
1553311112111112111.title: Revelations

choices: Follow Naruto and Hinata as they spend time together.
15533111121111121112.content:
After dinner and spending some sister time with Hanabi, Hinata was finally able to get ready for bed. Now wearing a light sleeping kimono Hinata moved under the covers of her bed. But she would not even think of sleeping, not when the book written by her hero lay near her pillow. Hinata had promised herself to read some of it before she slept and so she grabbed the book and carefully opened the seal-lock with a small burst of her chakra. Back in the Hokage’s office Sandaime Hokage had explained that too open the lock she needed to be keyed into its ID framework. The only problem was that only Uzumaki chakra wouldn’t react violently with the seal and cause its safety function to kick in. This feature was able to be worked around only by having Naruto channel some of his chakra into her where she would use her chakra to direct it through her and into the seal, this let the ID portion of the seal identify her as Naruto’s bonded Kunoichi.

Her excitement grew by leaps and bounds when she saw the latch pop open. It took all her restraint training to not simply rip the cover open and instead gently lift the cover to reveal…. Nothing!!! ‘Wait. That can’t be right!’ thought the chunky Hyuga girl as she flipped through the pages of the book only to see a blank white page each time. “But, why go through so much trouble for an empty book?” the girl asked herself in a disbelieving whisper. It was only when she reached the end that she found something. A message written in quick feminine handwriting. “All answers lie in the beginning? What does that mean?” Quickly she flipped back to the front finding something that hadn’t been their earlier. An odd looking seal painted upon the inside of the front cover stared back at the confused young girl, its design looked so complex that just looking at it hurt. Before she could look away to rest her eyes for a moment the seal started to glow. It was faint at first but quickly grew into a blinding flash of light. When the light died down Hinata had her head on her pillow seemingly asleep, the seal glowing softly upon the pages as they moved from cover to cover at an amazing pace.
--------------
He bolted upwards his body covered in a cold sweat, chest heaving as he panted and his blue eyes quickly searched the room. His search ended almost as quickly as it started as the whiskered blond quickly reached over to his nightstand and grabbed a book. The book in his hand looked ominous, almost evil, and held an aura of pain, fear and sorrow. Its black cover had odd red vain-like things covering it and in the dark room the red seemed to radiate an unholy glow. This book was his nightmare journal, something he had been writing in more often as he grew.

Naruto stole a quick glance at the clock over his bed before he pulled out a pen and moved to the next empty page. He sat like that for some time simply writing about his nightmare in excruciating detail, pausing only to try and refresh his memory of an event from the dream. As much as he hated reliving the nightmares something told him that these nightmares were important and so made sure to write about every detail that he could remember. Once done Naruto closed the book with a heavy sigh, looking towards his clock again he saw it was only ten after three. The half-awake blond got out of bed knowing he wouldn’t be able to go back to sleep and moved to a corner of his new room. The apartment the old man had given him was at least three times as large as his last one; this left him plenty of room for what he had set up in this one corner. An easel with some sketching and painting tools sat in this corner as well as a number of drawings he had already made.

Sitting himself down he began to lightly sketch whatever came to him while his mind wandered, by the time he stopped and looked at his sketch he found he had moved from sketching to painting the sketch without thought. He spent the next hour putting the finishing touches to the nearly finished image. Looking to the clock he made a mental note of the time and reminded himself that he was to meet Hinata at the park at 8 this morning. This left him with half an hour to get ready and arrive. Turning towards the picture he took it all in.

The bottom was a burning ruin that was once a village. In the center of these destroyed and burning buildings was the image of a young man with blond hair, his back facing anyone who may look upon the painted sketch. Before the boy hidden in the shadows made by the flames where nine shadowed figures, the glow of the flames and the red cloud pattern that covered them being the only reason you could see them. Moving to the middle of the painting the smoke from the fires gathered and blown to the left revealing the broken remains of one of the Hokage faces. Above the faces was another shadowed figure with only an odd orange swirl mask over its face. Behind the figure however was the most eye-catching part of this painting. The Moon. The celestial orb that Naruto always found so beautiful now gave off an eerie and sickly glow. In truth, it looked more like an eye then the moon, with its four concentric circles with nine tomoe in the three circles closest to the pupil. All in all, Naruto couldn’t help but, feel something was trying to warn him. Shaking it off he got up and began to get ready to go meet Hinata.
---------------
She didn’t know what to feel. So many emotions were running through her at this moment that she was surprised she hadn’t fainted from emotional overload. For the past few hours while her body rested her mind had been through the most trying of ordeals. She had seen it, from her earliest childhood memories to the moment of her death; Hinata was now the only person in all of Konoha who knew so much about Kushina Uzumaki. She had not only seen but, felt the woman’s emotions as she went through her life. The laughter and joy she felt with her friends, the love she felt for the blond who stole her heart, to the pain of childbirth. Hinata had felt everything that made the women she saw as her hero tick. Tears flowed down her cheeks as she remembered the wonderful woman’s parting words.

"Naruto… you're going to experience a lot of pain and suffering. Remember who you are! Find a goal… a dream… and don't stop trying until it comes true. There's… there's so much more that I want to say… to teach you… I want to stay with you… I love you.”

Forcing down her tears Hinata opened the book once more to find the seal and the message were now gone and in their place were various chapters of training methods and exercises designed just for kunoichi as well as details on Uzumaki clan traditions and ninja arts, complete with a section called ‘Fūinjutsu for dummies’. Seeing how she couldn’t rely on the seal appearing again Hinata vowed to give Naruto all the knowledge she now had on his mother herself. He deserved to know how much his mother loved him.

Exiting her bed Hinata quickly got ready for her day. She was to meet Naruto today so they could learn more about each other. When she was finally ready she hurried on her way stopping only to give her father a quick farewell and give Hanabi a promise to come home and spend some time with her in the afternoon.
15533111121111121112.title: The next morning

The shinobi will be able to feel the summoning creature once they tap into the kunoichi chakra. Beware of the giant insects. Although they won't kill you, they will delay your time to find the summoning creature before time runs out. And when the summoning creature is found and you make it to the other end of the forest, a graduation gift will be waiting. Good luck, Iruka-Sensei." Naruto just looks to Hinata, and she is very worried. She managed to say, "Should we begin?" While also saying it in her stuttering way. Naruto then took her and put her onto his back, piggy back style. He then said, "Lead the way." She felt something.

But they don't worry about dinner yet because they found the summon. It is a scroll that reads the symbol for summon. Naruto and Hinata open it, and she uses her chakra. Out comes this tiny orange toad. It says, "What do you people want!? If you want me to do anything, there better be treats...I ain't free." Naruto and Hinata just look at it, then back at each other, then back at it. Luckily, there is a river nearby, and Naruto gets to fishing. He has the toad, Gamakichi, resting on his head. After 30 minutes, he says, "This is really pathetic." Naruto then says, "Like you could do better!" And then a giant turtle, as big as the other Kunoichi in the academy, gets onto the beach. It has in it's moth a fish just as large as it. The turtle drops the fish on the ground and goes back into the river, possibly to get more. Naruto and Hinata start stripping pieces of the fish and then cooking it. They enjoy the meal. The turtle returns with a second fish and starts eating it with them. They are interested on why it helped. But they look over it and continue to the other side of the forest.
155331111211121.title: A few hours later

1553311112111212.content: Naruto and Hinata have nearly made it to the finish line, when a giant bug appears. It looks like an ant. But Naruto suddenly creates two shadow clones of himself, he then puts into them a decent amount of Hinata's chakra, and had them run off. This confused the giant ant and it chased after them instead. Naruto then says, "I'm surprised that worked." They both then start walking to the end of the forest. Naruto then says, "Hinata, Gamakichi, did you guys notice something odd?" Gamakichi says, "Like what?" And Naruto says, "Iruka Sensei said to don't die, and the note we found said there was a time limit. I studied my ass off last night on this exam. Nobody ever dies in this exam and there is no time limit...I think it's a scare tactic." Hinata then says, "And there's the turtle and ant." Gamakichi says, "Yeah...The turtle brought two fishes as large as whales to eat, and the giant ant ignored us for some weaker source of chakra." Naruto says, "I think Iruka Sensei sent them to keep us on edge." They then made it to the end of the forest and found a wooden door. They then go what looks like a library, but there is only one book. Naruto picks it up. There is no title on the book, and when he flips through the pages are blank. Gamakichi says, "You do realize that's a chakra book, right?" Hinata says, "So it can only be read when chakra flows in it?" And Naruto taps into Hinata's chakra and the title reads, History of the Hidden Leaf Village: Famous Shinobi and Kunoichi, techniques, strategy, and jutsu. Naruto looks through it and says, "Wow! This book tells us about details on everyone famous from the Hidden Leaf Village and their techniques and how to train to use it!" Hinata says, "Famous people?" And Naruto says, "The Hokage, War Heroes, Sannin, Sirens, you name it their here!"
1553311112111212.title: Small Delays...

15533111121112121.content: Naruto and Hinata had then been hit by a flash of light and found themselves standing before the third hokage and Iruka Sensei, sitting behind a long desk. The Third Hokage said, "Naruto Uzumaki, Hinata Hyuga. Congratulations on passing the test. I have a few gifts for the two of you. He then looks to Iruka, who pulls out a briefcase like object. He then opened it. The Old man said, "First, we would like to give to both of you your new headbands." Iruka pulled out the two headbands with the leaf symbol on them. The Old man continued, "And the second gift will be the name of one of your sensei's. One of them is Kakashi Hatake." He paused to bite onto his pipe, breathe through it, and continues, "And the last is this." He takes something out of his pocket, and tosses it to the two. Naruto catches it and finds a key with a leaf symbol key chain. He says, "You could say that it is customary for a Shinobi to live with their Kunoichi, so a law was passed that allows graduates to live in an apartment complex seated in a neighborhood called the starter homes." He then sees that Hinata has gotten a little red to this. He then gets a sinister grin that can't be seen by them, and says, "Now the apartment complex has two separate beds in them, but there can be only a single bed." As Hinata gets redder, Naruto also gets redder. Iruka catches on and says, "Yes, in fact, that's how most couples in the village are made...Like how Hinata's parents met." Now the two new ninja are beyond red. The Old man says, "Yes...Everyone of the ninja enjoy the alone time in those apartments, not just as partners, but-" He didn't even finish as the two ran off as fast as they could. Iruka said, "Be sure to move your things over, you will meet your new sensei's at the academy on saturday!" Once they are completely gone, they both break out laughing. Iruka says, "You'd think Ichiraku put up a new free ramen campaign."
15533111121112121.title: Continue

155331111211121211.content: Naruto and Hinata ran as fast as they could. The whole run was a blur. Naruto soon found himself standing in front of Ichiraku, and Hinata is nowhere to be found. He then looks at his new headband and puts it on. He then goes into for ramen, entering with a phrase said by the owner, "Naruto! How's my number one customer!?" And Naruto points to his headband with his thumb and says, "Like a graduate!" He then orders the usual ramen he gets. He starts eating, but finds himself constantly thinking of Hinata. He had no reason to, really, but just wanted to. He then thought she does look cute. Then he hears the owner welcome someone in. And Naruto is patted on the back and hears a friend say, "So, I heard you became a ninja today boss?" He turns around to see the old man's grandson and one of his friends, Konohamaru, wearing the same pair of goggles he used to wear. Naruto says, "That's right Konohamaru! And I got a new apartment!" He then flashes his new keys. Konohamaru then says, "So who's the Kunoichi you got?" And Naruto says, "Her name's Hinata. Real nice, very shy though." And Konohamaru says, "Hinata?...I think I'm in the same class as her sister." He then ordered some ramen and they both ate together. Then Iruka Sensei joined and they all had fun. Near the end, Iruka said, "You know Naruto, you and Hinata made the top four in teams." And Naruto said, "So who are the other teams?" And Iruka Sensei said, "Sakura Haruno, Ino Yamanaka, and Tenten." And Naruto asked, "So who are their ninja?" And Iruka Sensei says, "Sakura's is..."

1553311112112.content:
Minutes passed like hours for Hinata and the rest of those who passed. The victorious ladies sat together while the unlucky ones glared in anger and envy. Their eyes focused on Hinata more than the others as the tiny girl was able to find a shinobi while their bodies of far greater mass failed. Hinata felt even more worried as both Sakura and Ino had passed and they were arguing about who was the one who snagged Sasuke. And once again, Hinata was caught between their massive guts shaking with every bellow.

"There is no way Sasuke felt you! Naruto would sooner pick Hinata then Sasuke would pick you!" Ino yelled at the massive girl. Sakura growled and clenched her fists.

"This coming from the girl whose clan has been feeling out either the Nara or Akimichi clans!" Sakura yelled back. Ino pulled her hand back to slap Sakura when a soft cough made them all freeze. Turning Iruka was standing there. He had a scroll in his hand.

"Those who were felt, please come with me. Those who failed please remain. Another chunin will come and speak with you about when your solo tests will be," Iruka said. The girls who passed rose and followed Iruka out in single file. They walked down the hallway and stood before a door.

"In this room, you will meet your partner. You will also face your second test. It is fairly simple. You just need to not die," Iruka said.

"What do you mean by that?" Ino yelled. Iruka glared at Ino for her out burst. The massive girl shrunk back.

"I mean what I said. Your very lives will be at risk and unless you become one you will both die," Iruka said calmly. He paused a moment to let this sink into the girls' minds. He saw the fear growing in their eyes. Good. "Now when I call your name, you will walk in." He opened the scroll. "Ino Yamanaka" Ino smiled and walked in.

"I know it will be Sasuke," she proclaimed as she entered. Iruka paused for a moment.

"Hinata Hyuuga," he called. The small girl walked slowly to the door. As she entered, she was in darkness. Then the lamps lit up. She was standing on a seal. In front of her, her eyes widened as the man before her was not Naruto. She looked around, hoping she could ask to try again when she saw them. Two pairs of Kunochi and Shinobi put their powers together and Hinata and her partner vanished.

-------------

They were in the middle of the woods. There were two kunai near them and only each other to depend on. "Umm ... Hello," Hinata said as she blushed. This was not what she wanted, not who she hoped for as her partner was ....

choices: No, what are you doing, who would even want that?
